text: [United Kingdom](../) â€˜Escalation serves no oneâ€™: Sir Keir Starmer calls on Israel and Hezbollah to agree ceasefire in address to UN Sir Keir Starmer has called for Israel and Hezbollah to agree to a ceasefire, saying â€œescalation serves no oneâ€. Speaking at the United Nations General Assembly, the prime minister implored the two sides to â€œstep back from the brinkâ€. It comes after [Israeli](//news.sky.com/topic/israel-5981) Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his nationâ€™s troops would keep â€œfighting at full forceâ€ and that news of a potential ceasefire deal was â€œnot trueâ€. Addressing the nations of the world in New York, Sir Keir said: â€œI call on Israel and [Hezbollah](//news.sky.com/topic/hezbollah-8356): Stop the violence, step back from the brink.â€ Israel-Hezbollah latest: [Follow live updates here](//news.sky.com/story/israel-hezbollah-lebanon-war-latest-sky-news-live-12978800) The [UK prime minister](//news.sky.com/topic/keir-starmer-6820) added: â€œWe need to see an immediate ceasefire to provide space for a diplomatic settlement, and we are working with all partners to that end. â€œBecause further escalation serves no one.â€ In his speech, Sir Keir said the UN needs to â€œwork together for peace, progress and equalityâ€ â€“ including â€œpreventing a regional war in the Middle Eastâ€. More criticism of Russia Earlier in his trip to the UN, Sir Keir [criticised Russia for invading Ukraine](//news.sky.com/story/sir-keir-starmer-attacks-russia-for-treating-citizens-as-bits-of-meat-to-fling-into-grinder-13221737) in a meeting of the security council. Both the UK and Russia are permanent members of the UN Security Council. Addressing the general assembly, Sir Keir hinted at wanting to take further action against Russia for its invasion. He said: â€œWe must put new energy and creativity, into conflict resolution and conflict prevention, reverse the trend towards ever-greater violence, make the institutions of peace fit for purpose, and hold members to their commitments under the UN Charter.â€ Addressing the security council previously, Sir Keir said: â€œThe greatest violation of the charter in a generation has been committed by one of this councilâ€™s permanent members.â€ Pension to be invested in climate change During his speech, the prime minister repeated many of his previous pledges on UK domestic policy. However, he did appear to make one new announcement. Sir Keir pledged to put â€œbillionsâ€ from pension and insurance funds into â€œfighting climate changeâ€ and â€œboosting developmentâ€. The Labour government has repeatedly said it wants to use more private investment to build growth. Sir Keir added that the plans for pensions and insurance funds would be managed through a new facility at British International Investment â€“ part of the Foreign Office â€“ working alongside the City of London.
